Class NeuronList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Neuron>
          • boone.NeuronList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Neuron>, java.util.Collection<Neuron>, java.util.List<Neuron>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class NeuronList
extends java.util.ArrayList<Neuron>
implements Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    A list for neurons and methods to change the order of neurons.
    Version:
    $Id: NeuronList.java 2291 2015-12-04 17:45:14Z helmut $
    Author:
    Helmut A. Mayer
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuronList

        public NeuronList()
        Constructs an empty neuron list.

      • NeuronList

        public NeuronList(NeuralNet net)
        Constructs a new neuron list by copying the neuron list from the given network. Note that this is a shallow copy.
        Parameters:
        net - a neural network

    • Method Detail

      • orderTopo

        public boolean orderTopo()
        Sorts the neuron's of a feed-forward network in topological order, i.e., according to layer numbers. The input neurons are at the list start, and the output neurons at the end.
        Returns:
        true, if sorting is correct, false, if network is recurrent, then sorting in layers is not possible

      • orderRandom

        public void orderRandom()
        Returns this list of the given net with neurons in random order.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this neuron list.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.util.AbstractCollection<Neuron>
        Returns:
        a string describing each neuron in the list
